text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale, I am thrilled to
share this recipe with you today, because

it's such a great summer treat, it requires
four ingredients, they are my mango and coconut

Popsicle or coconut mango Popsicles, whatever
you want to call them.

Super great, super fun, super refreshing,
perfect for summer and like I said, less than
5 ingredients which is awesome in my book!

Alright, let's make the base which is going
to be the coconut portion.

You'll need two things, you'll need whole
coconut milk, and what I have here is some
cream of coconut.

You can see it's really thick and really creamy,
now cream of coconut is really sweet so you

don't need any additional sugar in this recipe
at all, because otherwise your teeth would
fall out because it's so sweet!

This is already really, really sweet, so it's
really easy.

No fancy machines, no ice cream machine, nothing
so it's going to be perfect for those days

when you're maybe home with the kids during
the summer - you know my mom used to like

to do little projects with us when we were
really little, and this would be a really

fun one to get them to do because there's
nothing major required!

Okay, so you add cream of coconut and your
coconut milk, and all you do is just whisk
these two together well, until they're combined.

This is ready, my Popsicle mold, I've had
this for years, it's super inexpensive, and

I definitely suggest investing in one because
it comes with the top that has the stick included
which means that I don't lose it!

Because I've had every other kind where I
had to add my own Popsicle sticks and I lose

them, I buy packs of them and I lose them
and then I'm stuck without and I just eat

it with a spoon, that's why I like this particular
one, okay all you do is fill these up about

two thirds of the way and that is going to
be your base.

Okay, now all I'm going to do is loosely cover
this with some plastic wrap and I'm going

to pop these into the freezer for about thirty
minutes, you need this first layer to be frozen

or somewhat set before you add your second
layer, now I, as you know, I'm not crafty,

nor am I patient but if I was, what you can
do is you can have your coconut mixture, you

can have your mango mixture, and you can alternate
layers.

so you can put your coconut and let that freeze
for twenty minutes, put mango let that freeze

for twenty minutes, coconut twenty minutes
freeze and then the final mango on top.

I don't have that kind of patience I mean,
let's face it so I'm just going to do mostly

coconut and then some mango on top, but you
can do that if you want to which I'm sure

you are way cooler than I am so you probably
will be doing that, but I'm just going to

pop these into the freezer for about thirty
minutes and then we'll get going on making
the mango mixture.

Alright so it's time to make the mango portion
of the coconut mango Popsicles, all you need

is a good ripe mango, a little less than half
of a lemon and some water.

That's it and like I said, no sugar necessary
because when something is in season, it's

so sweet, so as you can see just from the
color of this mango it's a gorgeous almost

orange color which is what you're looking
for, it's soft but somewhat still firm so

I could cut it but it's perfection I've been
eating them every single day, sometimes multiple
times a day.

You can do this in a blender but since I have
such a small amount to make I'm going to use

my mini chopper just because it's easier and
it's handy.

So all I'm going to do is throw everything
in, I've got the mango, little bit of mango,
not much, just want to wake it up a bit.
And then just some water.
And just puree until smooth, that's it!

Alright, I've got my mango, I've got my coconut,
now all you have to do is just fill the top

with the mango portion and because we froze
the coconut, it's not all going to mix together.
So it will be perfect!

Alright now put the tops on and pop these
into the freezer until set, it'll take a few
hours or you can do it overnight.
That's it!

Alright, these are completely set, they only
take a few hours once you add the mango puree,

so you can also so them overnight of course
and they'll be ready whenever you want.

I'm just going to take one and then what you
want to do is you want to dunk this into really
hot water just to loosen it a bit.

Kind of just tilt it and if it spills a little,
it's alright because I'll be cleaning it anyway.

Just to kind of loosen the Popsicle from the
mold, and do this with patience because you'll

probably have to dip it a couple of times
but look!
Voila!

Now like I said you can do multiple layers,
but you know you'll have to make sure that

your coconut mixture and mango mixture in
each layer sets for a good twenty to thirty

minutes and home girl has no patience so this
is good enough for me.
Mmm!
Coconut is so good!
It's sweet because of that cream of coconut.
No sugar necessary.

And that mango is like pure mango, no frills,
nothing in there to change the flavor whatsoever.

And because it's so soft and it's in season
it's super sweet, again no sugar necessary.
That is perfect!

You should really make these, they're like
the perfect summer treat, doesn't require

a fancy machine, doesn't require a lot of
ingredients, they're delicious and everyone
will love them.

Go to LauraintheKitchen.com to get the written
recipe hope you've enjoyed spending time with
me and we'll see you very soon!
Bye!
